question: I have hypertension that started as "white coat" in nature and has progressed to chronic. It used to be that my BP would be a little elevated in the clinic but normal at home.  Now it's high even when I check it at home.  I feel like there's a very strong "stress response" component to my HTN, as I have a strong physiologic response to stress at times (for example, when I go in for a doctor visit, I have palpitations and get sweaty palms as soon as they start coming at me with the blood pressure cuff).  In fact, in the past I've been treated for anxiety disorder.  So I have 3 questions:1. I know beta blockers are not typically used as first-line agents, but I'm wondering if I should give it a try in my case?2. What are the long-term effects of beta blockers (I've read beta blockers + diuretics may increase risk of diabetes type 2)?3. Should I go with a cardioselective or nonselective beta blocker, or does it matter?(I have no personal or family history of diabetes and no lung disease.)Thanks!
title: Beta blockers
